content: Schnorr published the (at least) third revision of a WIP paper, claiming the destroy of RSA. "This destroys the RSA cryptosystem." in his own word.

Fast Factoring Integers by SVP Algorithms, corrected

Claus Peter Schnorr
I'm not an expert of cryptography, it's just a wish: I hope someday formal verification tools like Lean (and their theorem libraries) will be mature enough to verify paper like this.

The Liquid Tensor Experiment is an amazing breakthrough in the application of pure mathematics. Maybe someday someone will propose a similar challenge in theoretical computer science, cryptograhy, and so on?

I'm not sure that a Lean chat is a place to talk about a random unrefereed Lean-free preprint and I'm even less sure that it's worth creating a new stream for such a conversation. How about we wait until the math/CS community has decided on the worth of the paper? If the author thinks their algorithm is better than the standard ones then why isn't the author proving this by going further than the standard algorithms e.g. by factoring some RSA numbers? When this happens I'm sure there will be a conversation to be had.
My apology! please let me know what's appropriate, should I merge it to some other stream, or can someone help to do that? or should this conversation be archived at all?

My experience is that talking about unrefereed preprints which claim amazing things is pretty much always a waste of time unless you're an expert in the domain who feels like making their opinions public.
I agree with you, sorry about that.
Is there a way to delete this stream? or should I mute it?

Archiving a stream is only available to organization owners and administrators.

https://fmcthanos.zulip.com/help/archive-a-stream

Sorry for that! Appreciate it if some admin doesn't mind archive this stream. Learn something today, won't make the same mistake next time.
Probably @Bryan Gin-ge Chen should just move this thread to #new members or #general, then the stream will be empty
